alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 6:25PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Graham County through 700 PM CDT... At 623 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Hill City, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...The automated observation site at Hill City measured a 52 mph wind gust at 613 PM CDT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Graham County, including the following locations... Penokee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
